documents.name: Terms of Service
documents.text:
Last modified on Oct 12, 2015

Vent’s Terms and Conditions of Use in full detail.

Suped Pty Ltd ACN 165 010 346 (Vent, we, or us) owns and operates the application for use on mobile devices called “Vent” and related website (collectively referred to as Site). These Terms and Conditions of Use (Terms) govern your access to and use of the Site, and any information, text, graphics, photos or other materials uploaded, downloadced or appearing on the Site (collectively referred to as Content).

Your use of the Site is conditional upon your agreement to, acceptance of and compliance with the terms and conditions set out below (including our Privacy Policy and Community Guidelines) and the Terms are legally binding on you. You must read these Terms carefully before your use of the Site.

We reserve the right to amend these Terms at any time. You will be deemed to have accepted the terms and conditions as amended by your continued access to and use of the Site.

Any content or information you provide to us will be dealt with in accordance with our Privacy Policy, which can be found by clicking here.

Intellectual Property

All information, text, material, images, audio, video, graphics, software and advertisements on the Site (Material) are copyright © 2015 Suped Pty Ltd ACN 165 010 346, its associated companies, suppliers, and/or licensors unless expressly indicated otherwise. The materials are protected by Australian and international copyright laws.

You must not modify, copy, reproduce, republish, frame, upload to a third party, post, transmit, distribute or in any way deal with the Material except as expressly provided on the Site, or expressly authorised in writing by us.

You must not use the Site trade marks, logos or other materials for any purpose without the prior written consent of Vent.

You may, subject to specific restrictions set out in these Terms, download Material from the Site solely for your personal, non-commercial use. You must not distribute such Material in any form to any third party. You agree not to change or delete any proprietary notices from any Material downloaded from the Site.

Age

No user is to upload Works to the Site unless the user is aged 13 years or older.

Registration  Email

For increased anonymity, you may wish to set up an email account with an email provider who does not require you to enter any Personal Information to create the account. Not linking the email account to any of your other social media will also minimize the amount of Personal Information you are providing when you register to use the Site.

Security

Your user name and password are for your use only and are not transferable. You are responsible for safeguarding the password that you use to access the Site and for any activities or actions under your password.

We encourage you to use “strong” passwords (passwords that use a combination of upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols) in relation to your account. Vent cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from your failure to comply with the above.

Content and Uploads

All information, text, graphics, photos, comments or other materials uploaded, downloaded or appearing on the Site (Content), whether publicly posted or privately transmitted, is the sole responsibility of the person who created such Content.

Vent does not take responsibility for such Content. Any use or reliance upon any Content or materials posted on the Site or obtained by you through the Site is at your own risk.

Vent does not endorse, support, represent or guarantee the completeness, truthfulness, accuracy or reliability of any Content posted on the Site or endorse any opinions expressed on the Site. You understand that by using the Site, you may be exposed to Content that might be offensive, harmful, inaccurate or otherwise inappropriate, or in some cases, postings that have been mislabelled or are otherwise deceptive. Under no circumstances will the Company be liable in any way for any Content, including, but not limited to, any errors or omissions in the Content, or any loss or damage of any kind incurred as a result of the use of any Content posted, emailed, transmitted or otherwise made available on the Site.

Users must not:

  • upload any information, text, data, program or comments on the Site (Works) which are false, misleading or deceptive;
  • post or upload any Works which are libellous, defamatory or which discloses private or personal matters concerning any person, or any Works which are indecent, obscene or pornographic;
  • post or transmit any Works that would violate the property rights of others, including unauthorised copyrighted text, images or programs, trade secrets or other confidential information, or trade or services marks;
  • post or transmit any file or data which contains viruses or any other contaminating or destructive features;
  • post or transmit any Works which are harmful, threatening, abusive or hateful;
  • post or transmit charity requests, petitions for signature, chain letters or letters relating to pyramid schemes. and/or
  • use the facilities of the Site to conduct any activity or solicit the performance of any activity which is illegal or which infringes the rights of others
  • express or imply that any statements you make are endorsed by Vent without our specific prior written consent
  • post content which solicits passwords or personal identifying information for commercial or unlawful purposes from other users

If Vent suspects that material which has been uploaded contravenes any of the above conditions, Vent reserves the rights to take down that material without notice to the user who uploaded it.

Vent will not be responsible for any consequential loss or damage caused to the user by the removal of the material.

Vent reserves the right at all times (but will not be obliged) to remove or refuse to post any Content on the Site, to suspend or terminate registered users, and to reclaim usernames without liability to any such user or third party.

Vent also reserves the right to access, read, preserve, and disclose any information as we reasonably believe is necessary to:

(a) satisfy any applicable law, regulation, legal process or governmental request;

(b) enforce the Terms, including investigation of potential violations thereof;

(c) detect, prevent, or otherwise address fraud, security or technical issues,

(d) respond to user support requests. or

(e) protect the rights, property or safety of Vent, its users and the public.

Community Guidelines

The Community Guidelines establish the boundaries for the content and behaviours that we expect from our users. . Vent reserves the right at all times (but will not be obliged) to remove or refuse to post any Content on the Site, to suspend or terminate registered users, and to reclaim usernames without liability to any such user or third party where the Community Guidelines have been determined to have been breached.

Copyright Policy

Vent respects the intellectual property rights of others and expects users of the Site to do the same.

We will respond to notices of alleged copyright infringement that comply with applicable law and are properly provided to us at help@vent.co. If you believe that your Content has been copied in a way that constitutes copyright infringement, please provide us with the following information:

  1. identification of the copyright work said to have been infringed;
  2. identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or to be the subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or access to which is to be disabled, and information reasonably sufficient to permit us to locate the material;
  3. your contact information, including your address, telephone number and an email address;
  4. a statement by you that you have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorised by the copyright owner, its agent or the law. and
  5. a statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and that you are authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner.

We reserve the right to remove Content alleged to be infringing without prior notice, at our sole discretion, and without liability to the users involved. In appropriate circumstances, we will also terminate a user’s account if the user is determined to be a repeat infringer.

Communication

The Site may now or in the future contain communication facilities such as forums and chat rooms, which provide for real-time communication between users of the Site, for feedback to us, messaging and notice services. We reserve the right (but not the obligation) to monitor such communication facilities and the communications and Content posted from time to time. While we reserve the right to monitor such communication facilities, we do not, cannot, and are under no obligation to, review all communications and third party materials posted or uploaded to the Site and are not responsible for the content of these communications and third party materials.

Vent does reserve the right to block, edit or remove from the Site communications and third party materials which Vent in its sole discretion determines to be abusive, defamatory or obscene, fraudulent, misleading or deceptive, a breach of any third party intellectual property rights, a breach of any law or these Terms, or offensive or otherwise unacceptable to the Company.

You acknowledge and agree that Vent has no control over users of the Site, and is under no circumstances liable for the behaviour, opinions or conduct of such users, including but not limited to any information, materials or advice provided by them, any defamatory or otherwise offensive statements.

Warranty

By uploading Works to the Site, the user warrants as follows:

1. That either:

(a) the Works contain no third party content (including music or images). or

(b)the user has obtained licences to include any third party content in the Works and to upload it to the Site, and holds the necessary rights to grant the Licence. and

2. That any person appearing in the Works consented to the use of their name and/or image and/or voice in the Works, the uploading of the Worksto the Site and the granting of the Licence;

(together, the Warranties).

Indemnity

You agree to indemnify Vent and keep Vent, its officers, directors, employees, servants, agents, licensors, licensees and suppliers, indemnified from and against all losses, expenses, damages and costs, including reasonable legal fees, resulting from any breach of these Terms, the Warranties or any activity related to use of the Site (including negligent or wrongful conduct) by you or any other person using your registered account.

As part of providing you the Services, we may need to provide you with certain communications, such as service announcements and administrative messages. These communications are considered part of the Services and your Vent account, which you may not be able to opt-out from receiving.

License to Vent

By using and placing any Works on the Site you grant Vent and its affiliates a world-wide, perpetual, non-exclusive, royalty-free licence to use the Works in any manner and in any medium, at Vent’s sole discretion, including to reproduce, transmit, distribute, adapt, publicly perform and display the Works subject to the Privacy Policy (through all media now known or hereafter created) (Licence).

You expressly waive in favour of Vent any moral rights or similar rights you have in any jurisdiction in respect of the Works. If requested by Vent you agree to enter into any further agreements necessary to document the licence and waiver set out above, at Vent’s expense.

You further grant all users of the Site permission to view your content for their personal, non-commercial purposes. If you make suggestions to Vent on improving or adding new features to the Site, Vent shall have the right to use your suggestions without any compensation to you.

Monitoring

Each user of the Site is responsible for the content he or she uploads to the Site. We do not actively monitor content and will not censor user content, except in the limited circumstances described above and in our Privacy Policy.

You can file a report that someone is uploading abusive, objectionable or threatening content to the Site either directly within the application or by emailing your report to moderator@vent.co.

Once you have submitted your report, we will review the reported user account, including any particular Vents that have been reported. If the Vent user has violated any of our policies set out in these Terms, we will take action, ranging from removing the reported content &. warning the responsible user up to permanently suspending the user account of the person responsible for uploading the content.

If someone has used the Site to threaten or intimidate you, you should report the threat to the police so they can accurately assess the legitimacy of the threat. Vent does not have the ability to investigate and assess a threat, bring charges or prosecute individuals. If the police contact Vent to investigate a threat, we can work with them to provide the required information for their investigation.

Variation and Termination

These Terms shall continue to have full force and effect until varied or terminated by Vent. Vent reserves the right to terminate this agreement and your access to the Site at any time for any reason or for no reason.  The Terms relating to intellectual property, your licences to Vent, the indemnity granted by you, and all disclaimers and limitations of liability shall survive the termination of this agreement.

Vent reserves the right to vary these Terms at any time, including by posting new or varied Terms on the Site. You will be given the opportunity to accept such varied Terms on your first visit to the Site after such variation occurs, and if you elect not to accept the Terms as varied your permission to use the Site will terminate immediately.

General

This agreement is governed by the laws of the State of Victoria, Australia.  You irrevocably submit to the jurisdiction of the courts of that State.

If any provision of this agreement is found to be invalid or unenforceable by a court of law, such invalidity or unenforceable shall not affect the remainder of the agreement which shall continue to have full force and effect.

The waiver by Vent of a breach of these Terms by you shall not be construed as a waiver of any other breach of these Terms by you and shall not in any way restrict Vent’s right to exercise its rights pursuant to this agreement in respect of any other breach of these Terms.

documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
Last modified on Oct 12, 2015

Vent’s Privacy Policy in full detail.

Vent is a live social media app. It instantly connects people and lets them express their feelings. Any registered user can post a vent, which is a message that is public by default and can include other content like photos, videos, and links to other websites. It is important to note that what you post on the Site may be viewed by anyone, anywhere instantly.

Suped Pty Ltd ACN 165 010 346 (Vent, we, us, our), is the owner and operator of the website www.vent.co and associated application for use on mobile devices (together referred to as Site). By using the Site you agree to use the Site subject to the Terms and Conditions and this Privacy Policy.

Public Information

You acknowledge that when you post content on the Site, you are requesting us to make that content public. This public information includes not only the vents you post and your avatar, but also the metadata provided with the vents, such as when and where you posted the vent (should you chose to enable location services), as well as the people you follow on the Site, the vents you mark as favourites or respond to and many other bits of information that result from your use of the Site.

We make all of this public information public until you choose to delete it from the Site.

Personal Information

This Privacy Policy describes how and when we collect and use personally identifiable information provided by users of the Site (you), which may include, but is not limited to, your username, email address, avatar and other like information (Personal Information). It also describes the choices available to you regarding our use of your Personal Information and how you can access and update this information.

This policy covers any Personal Information collected or received by us as a result of your use of the Site, in relation to any posts you make and your use of any of our services or products.

Although we will not make your Personal Information publicly available except  in accordance with this policy, you can limit the amount of Personal Information you provide by registering an account on the Site using an email address which is not linked to your other social media accounts. You may wish to create an email account with an email provider that does not require Personal Information in order to register, such as Hotmail or Gmail.

Our Policy Towards Children

Our services and use of the Site are not available to persons under 13 without the prior consent of their legal guardian.

If you are a legal guardian and you become aware that your child has provided us with Personal Information without your consent, please contact us at help@vent.co. We do not knowingly collect Personal Information from children under 13. If we become aware that a child under 13 has provided us with Personal Information, we will take steps to remove that Personal Information and to terminate the child’s account.

Collection and use of Personal Information

Vent may collect your Personal Information when:

  • you register as a user of the Site or any of our services. and
  • you visit a page of the Site;

We may collect the following Personal Information from you:

  • your email address and username if you choose to provide it to us. and
  • information about your device such as your IP address and operating system.

We collect this Personal Information to provide our services to you. We may also use Personal Information for related purposes such as:

  • to communicate with you;
  • to provide services you require and provide requested information;
  • to perform statistical analyses of user behaviour;
  • maintaining our relationship with you, including responding to your questions;
  • internal accounting and administration;
  • protecting you and ourselves from fraud. and
  • any other use for which we obtain your permission.

We will not use your Personal Information for direct marketing purposes or for any other purpose without your approval.

We may also obtain unsolicited Personal Information from you. This may happen when:

  • you post a vent containing Personal Information on our Site. or
  • you interact with other users of the Site, including following those users and liking their vents, responding to vents posted on the Site and other like interactions, in a manner which discloses your Personal Information.

This is not Personal Information that we solicit from you, but in posting it on the Site is may become visible to other users and will be stored on our servers. We will not make any secondary use of unsolicited Personal Information.

Sharing Your Information

Vent recognises the trust you place in us when you give us your Personal Information. Other than disclosure as directed by you or to service providers (described below) or as required by law (for example, disclosure to various Government departments or courts), our policy is that we do not give your Personal Information to other organisations unless you have given us your consent to do so.

By using the Site, you consent to us sharing or disclosing your Personal Information in the ways set out in this policy.

We may share your Personal Information with certain third parties, such as the providers of the electronic systems we use to collect and store your Personal Information and other service providers we use to help us to run aspects of our business efficiently, including offshore servers. Occasionally Vent might also use your Personal Information for other purposes or share your information with another organisation because:

  • we believe it is necessary to provide you with a service which you have requested;
  • we believe it is necessary to protect the rights, property or personal safety of other users of the Site;
  • we believe it is necessary to do so to prevent or help detect fraud or serious credit infringements – for example, we may share information with other credit reporting agencies, law enforcement agencies and fraud protection units;
  • we believe it is necessary to protect the interests of Vent – for example, disclosure to a court in the event of legal action to which Vent is a party. or
  • the assets and operations of the business are being transferred to another party as a going concern.

When we share information with other organisations and service providers as set out above, we do so in accordance with the Privacy Policy. To the extent that these organisations and service providers gain access to your Personal Information, they are covered by strict privacy rules that prevent them from keeping this information or using this information for any purpose. We will not share your personal information with any third party organizations for marketing purposes.

Cross Border Transfers

Information that Vent collects may be stored and processed in and transferred between any of the countries in which the Company operates to enable to use of the information in accordance with this policy, including the USA. In addition, Public Information that you submit for publication on the Site will be published on the internet any may be available around the world. By using the Site and Vent’s services you agree to such cross-border transfers of your Personal Information.

Security

The security of your personal information is important to us. We endeavor to take all reasonable steps to keep your Personal Information secure. We store this information on secure cloud-based servers using Amazon’s AWS technology that are based in the USA in protected in access-controlled facilities. Once it is stored on our servers, only authorized users can access your Personal Information, and access is only for approved purposes.

Vent is not responsible for any third-party access to your Personal Information as a result of:

  • interception while it is in transit over the internet;
  • spyware or viruses on the device (such as a computer or phone) from which you access the Site or post a vent;
  • your failure to adequately protect your membership username or password;

or any losses, expenses, damages, including legal fees, resulting from such access.

We enable you to create an account, and share messages with others within your network and others who use the Site. We cannot control the actions of others with whom you may choose to share your information. Also we cannot guarantee that the content you post on our site will not be viewed by others outside your network or those who are not registered users of the Site.

If you have any questions about security on our Web site, you can contact us at help@vent.co

Providing information on other sites

The Site provides links to some other sites outside of the Site. Sometimes other sites – such as other social networking sites – link back to the Site. These linked Sites are not under our control, so we are not responsible for the conduct of companies linked to our Site. Before you enter information on those sites, you should look at their privacy policy and terms and conditions of use.

Accessing information we keep about you

You can access your Personal Information we hold about you at any time. Simply contact us to make your request at help@vent.co

We will always endeavor to meet your request for access. However, in some circumstances we may decline a request for access. This includes the following circumstances:

  • we no longer hold or use the information;
  • providing access would have an unreasonable impact on the privacy of other persons;
  • the request is frivolous or vexatious;
  • this information relates to existing or anticipated legal proceedings and would not normally be disclosed as part of those proceedings;
  • providing access would be unlawful;
  • providing access would be likely to prejudice the detection, prevention, investigation and prosecution of possible unlawful activity. and
  • the information would reveal our commercially sensitive decision-making process.

If we decline your request for access, we will give you reasons for our decision when we respond to your request.

We reserve the right to charge you a reasonable fee for access to some types of information. These charges will be limited to the cost of recouping our expenses for providing you with information. For example, document retrieval, photocopying, labour and delivery to you. We will not charge you to make a request to access your information.

Despite anything contained in this Policy to the contrary, the Freedom of Information Act 1982 continues to apply to any Personal Information held by us. The access and correction requirements in the Privacy Act 1988 operate alongside and do not replace other informal or legal procedures by which an individual can be provided access to, or correction of, their Personal Information.

Changing or deleting the information

To provide you with the best possible service, it is important that the information we hold about you is accurate. We will take all reasonable steps to ensure that your Personal Information is accurate, complete and up-to-date at the time of collecting, using or disclosing the information.

If you believe that any information we hold about you is inaccurate, incomplete or out-of-date, you should notify us. We will do our best to correct or delete it, unless we need to keep it for legal reasons.

How long we will keep your Personal Information

We will keep your Personal Information for as long as it is required to provide you with our services according to the Terms and Conditions and to comply with legal requirements. If we no longer require your Personal Information for any purpose, including legal purposes, we will take reasonable steps to securely destroy or permanently de-identify your Personal Information.

What to do if you have a problem, question or complaint

If you have any further queries relating to our Privacy Policy, or you have a concern, please contact us at help@vent.co. If Vent becomes aware of any ongoing concerns or problems with your Personal Information, we will take these issues seriously and work to address those concerns within a reasonable time.

Changes to this Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes to our information practices from time to time. Vent reserves the right to change this Privacy Policy at any time and notify you by posting an updated version of the policy on the Site.

We encourage you to periodically review this page for the latest information on our privacy practices. By continuing to access or use Vent after those changes become effective, you agree to be bound by the revised Privacy Policy.

Contact

You can contact us about this privacy statement by emailing us at the following address: help@vent.co
